name: The old trustworthy
description: Dell Intel Core i7-7500U, 12gb ram, Windows 10. It's been with me through thick and thin since more than 7 years now, running everything from game engines to a hundred (with 'a hundred' I mean 10 or 12) Opera tabs at once. It may not be the fastest, but hey, it gets the job done.

name: Graphics Tablet
description: Wacom Cintiq 21UX DTK-2100. A magical slab that turns my chaotic hand movements into digital 'art'. Great for sketching, designing, and sometimes just doodling nonsense when I'm supposed to be facing real life challenges :')

name: Playdate Console
description: This tiny yellow 1bit wonder lets me test the games I develop in the Playdate SDK on real hardware. Crank-powered gaming at its finest. People think it's a Tamagotchi. It is not.

name: T.E. PO-20 Arcade
description: 'Teenage Engineering Pocket Operator 20 Arcade' - A pocket-sized music machine that lets me create retro arcade beats wherever I go. AAA batteries powered, has a clock, and it's yellow.

name: Pen & Paper
description: For when I need to dump ideas the old-fashioned way. Also great for breaking down big problems into bite-sized chunks, and sketching on the run.

name: Books
description: Fuel for the mind! Some for learning, some for inspiration, and... Some comics and manga as well.
